articles.headline: Former Fed Chief Attacks Bush on Fiscal Role
articles.snippet: In his memoir, Alan Greenspan is critical of Republicans for abandoning their principles on spending and deficits.
articles.abstract: In his memoir, Alan Greenspan is critical of Republicans for abandoning their principles on spending and deficits.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Sept. 14 — Alan Greenspan, who was chairman of the Federal Reserve for nearly two decades, in a long-awaited memoir, is harshly critical of President Bush, Vice President Dick Cheney and the Republican-controlled Congress, as abandoning their party’s principles on spending and deficits.
articles.byline: By Edmund L. Andrews and David E. Sanger

articles.headline: Managing Outcomes Helps a Children’s Hospital Climb in Renown
articles.snippet: The Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center has used its focus on rare or complex conditions to emerge as a national name in pediatric medicine, drawing patients from distant cities.
articles.abstract: The Cincinnati Children’s Hospital Medical Center has used its focus on rare or complex conditions to emerge as a national name in pediatric medicine, drawing patients from distant cities.
articles.lead_paragraph: CINCINNATI — Although it is nearly 2,000 miles from Boise, Idaho, Cincinnati Children’s Hospital means to make a visit here worth a patient’s journey.

articles.headline: Ayn Rand’s Literature of Capitalism
articles.snippet: Ayn Rand’s “Atlas Shrugged,”a glorification of the right of individuals to live entirely for their own interest, influenced Alan Greenspan and others.
articles.abstract: Ayn Rand’s “Atlas Shrugged,”a glorification of the right of individuals to live entirely for their own interest, influenced Alan Greenspan and others.
articles.lead_paragraph: One of the most influential business books ever written is a 1,200-page novel published 50 years ago, on Oct. 12, 1957. It is still drawing readers; it ranks 388th on Amazon.com’s best-seller list. (“Winning,” by John F. Welch Jr., at a breezy 384 pages, is No. 1,431.)

articles.headline: Banks Try Easing Into a $26 Billion Debt Sale
articles.snippet: Next week’s debt offering financing the purchase of the First Data Corporation is widely seen as an indicator of whether the credit markets have begun to thaw.
articles.abstract: Next week’s debt offering financing the purchase of the First Data Corporation is widely seen as an indicator of whether the credit markets have begun to thaw.
articles.lead_paragraph: Banks financing the purchase of the First Data Corporation by the equity firm Kohlberg Kravis Roberts made several concessions on the debt sale yesterday as they tried to lure skittish investors.
articles.byline: By Michael J. de la Merced

articles.headline: Tell-All PCs and Phones Transforming Divorce
articles.snippet: In the digital age, it’s growing increasingly difficult to hide dirty secrets from former spouses in divorce cases.
articles.abstract: In the digital age, it’s growing increasingly difficult to hide dirty secrets from former spouses in divorce cases.
articles.lead_paragraph: The age-old business of breaking up has taken a decidedly Orwellian turn, with digital evidence like e-mail messages, traces of Web site visits and mobile telephone records now permeating many contentious divorce cases.

articles.headline: Credit Crisis Hits Lender in Britain
articles.snippet: Northern Rock’s need for emergency financing represents a broadening of the effects of the global financial crisis.
articles.abstract: Northern Rock’s need for emergency financing represents a broadening of the effects of the global financial crisis.
articles.lead_paragraph: LONDON, Sept. 14 — Depositors of a big British mortgage lender, Northern Rock, rushed to withdraw money on Friday after the bank, unable to raise financing because of the tight credit market, turned to the Bank of England for an emergency loan.

articles.headline: At the U.S. Border, the Desert Takes a Rising Toll
articles.snippet: The number of migrants dying while trying to cross into Pima County, Ariz., is on pace this year to set a record.
articles.abstract: The number of migrants dying while trying to cross into Pima County, Ariz., is on pace this year to set a record.
articles.lead_paragraph: SASABE, Ariz. — “I can’t breathe,” Felicitas Martínez Barradas gasped to her cousin as they stumbled across the border in 100-degree heat. “The sun is killing me.”

articles.headline: It’s Just a Matter of Equity
articles.snippet:
A warning that “innovations” are eroding a once-superior
business model, from the man whom many consider to be the intellectual father of private equity.
articles.abstract:
A warning that “innovations” are eroding a once-superior
business model, from the man whom many consider to be the intellectual father of private equity.
articles.lead_paragraph: The moribund private equity market stirred a bit last week as Kohlberg Kravis Roberts dredged up some buyers for loans to finance its $22 billion purchase of Alliance Boots, a British drugstore chain. But lingering investor wariness toward private equity maestros and their deals is far from the only problem facing the buyout business. There are graver threats that are, no surprise, the industry’s own making.

articles.headline: Death in the Chair, Step by Remorseless Step
articles.snippet: Daryl Holton, who killed his four children in a marital dispute, was put to death in a Tennessee electric chair.
articles.abstract: Daryl Holton, who killed his four children in a marital dispute, was put to death in a Tennessee electric chair.
articles.lead_paragraph: NASHVILLE

articles.headline: Bye, Bye B-School
articles.snippet: Many young people on the fast track to fat paydays in the financial industry are choosing to forgo M.B.A. programs.
articles.abstract: Many young people on the fast track to fat paydays in the financial industry are choosing to forgo M.B.A. programs.
articles.lead_paragraph: MOST people who knew Gabriel Hammond at Johns Hopkins in the late 1990s could have predicted he would rise quickly on Wall Street. As a freshman, he traded stocks from his dorm room, making a $1,000 bet on Caterpillar. Soon after, he abandoned his childhood dream of becoming a lawyer and, upon graduation, joined Goldman Sachs as a stock analyst.

articles.headline: The Dialysis Business: Fair Treatment?
articles.snippet: Congress is moving to stop separate Medicare reimbursement in order to end an incentive to overuse a drug frequently given to dialysis patients.
articles.abstract: Congress is moving to stop separate Medicare reimbursement in order to end an incentive to overuse a drug frequently given to dialysis patients.
articles.lead_paragraph: El Segundo, Calif.

articles.headline: Vocal on Iraq, McCain Keeps Quiet on Bush
articles.snippet: As he campaigns, Senator John McCain has focused his support for the Iraq war on Gen. David H. Petraeus.
articles.abstract: As he campaigns, Senator John McCain has focused his support for the Iraq war on Gen. David H. Petraeus.
articles.lead_paragraph: Defiant and energetic, Senator John McCain has taken his “No Surrender” tour to V.F.W. halls, parades and barbecues in Iowa, New Hampshire and South Carolina. He talks about his support for a renewed effort to win the Iraq war. He pays tribute to Gen. David H. Petraeus and the report he issued about progress in Iraq.
articles.byline: By Adam Nagourney and Michael Cooper

articles.headline: Fund-Raiser’s Wallet Matched His Need to Please
articles.snippet: Campaigns and charities took Norman Hsu’s money, while at the same time harboring doubts about his background and behavior.
articles.abstract: Campaigns and charities took Norman Hsu’s money, while at the same time harboring doubts about his background and behavior.
articles.lead_paragraph: This article was reported by Don Van Natta Jr., Mike McIntire, Patrick Healy and Leslie Wayne and written by Mr. Van Natta and Mr. McIntire.
articles.byline: By Don Van Natta Jr. and Mike McIntire

articles.headline: After Scandal, HBO’s Former Leader Lands at IMG
articles.snippet: Chris Albrecht plans to join the talent agency, which has been quietly building an international broadcasting business, as head of its global media unit.
articles.abstract: Chris Albrecht plans to join the talent agency, which has been quietly building an international broadcasting business, as head of its global media unit.
articles.lead_paragraph: Chris Albrecht, the former chief executive of HBO who helped develop hits like “The Sopranos” and “Sex and the City,” is planning to join IMG, the talent agency that has been quietly building an international broadcasting business, as the head of its global media unit.

articles.headline: At 25, ‘McPaper’ Is All Grown Up
articles.snippet: An older, more serious USA Today is facing the challenge of readers and advertisers fleeing to the Internet.
articles.abstract: An older, more serious USA Today is facing the challenge of readers and advertisers fleeing to the Internet.
articles.lead_paragraph: This summer, a series of long, investigative articles explored why most American troops in Iraq still do not have vehicles that could protect them from explosives, though the vehicles were available years ago and the Iraqi military has them.

articles.headline: Red Carpet Meets Harsh War
articles.snippet: Are audiences ready for the steady stream of movies and documentaries that bring a faraway war very close?
articles.abstract: Are audiences ready for the steady stream of movies and documentaries that bring a faraway war very close?
articles.lead_paragraph: At the beginning of the month, an eager crowd gathered in Midtown Manhattan at the Morgan Library to see “Alive Day Memories,” an HBO documentary that featured interviews of grievously wounded veterans conducted by James Gandolfini, the star of “The Sopranos.”

articles.headline: Publications on Fitness and Health Head to Web
articles.snippet: In an attempt to court readers and advertising dollars, Hearst Magazines is purchasing Real Age Inc., a consumer health Web site.
articles.abstract: In an attempt to court readers and advertising dollars, Hearst Magazines is purchasing Real Age Inc., a consumer health Web site.
articles.lead_paragraph: Magazines and newspapers across the country are building up their Web offerings in health and fitness as their specialized advertising dollars and readers migrate online at a particularly rapid pace.

articles.headline: Sectarian Toll Includes Scars to Iraq Psyche
articles.snippet: Iraqis fleeing their homes are leaving behind uncrossable neighborhood lines and a shattered sense of trust.
articles.abstract: Iraqis fleeing their homes are leaving behind uncrossable neighborhood lines and a shattered sense of trust.
articles.lead_paragraph: BAGHDAD, Sept. 16 — Violence swept over the Muhammad family in December, taking the father, the family’s house and all of its belongings in one chilly morning. But after the Muhammads fled, it subsided and life re-emerged — ordinary and quiet — in its wake.

articles.headline: Though Adversaries, Auto Talk Leaders Have Much in Common
articles.snippet: Both Ron Gettelfinger, president of the United Automobile Workers union, and Rick Wagoner, chief executive of General Motors have everything on the line in negotiations that continued Sunday.
articles.abstract: Both Ron Gettelfinger, president of the United Automobile Workers union, and Rick Wagoner, chief executive of General Motors have everything on the line in negotiations that continued Sunday.
articles.lead_paragraph: DETROIT, Sept. 16 — Ron Gettelfinger, the president of the United Automobile Workers union, and Rick Wagoner, the chief executive of General Motors, may seem to be at opposite ends of the automotive spectrum.

articles.headline: Seeking Relief
articles.snippet: Sizing up the alternatives as a summer of air delays, cancellations and missed connections stretches into fall.
articles.abstract: Sizing up the alternatives as a summer of air delays, cancellations and missed connections stretches into fall.
articles.lead_paragraph: NOW what?

articles.headline: An Indispensable Irritant to Iran and Its Foes
articles.snippet: Mohamed ElBaradei’s deal with Iran is one of the biggest gambles of his tenure as head of the U.N. nuclear agency.
articles.abstract: Mohamed ElBaradei’s deal with Iran is one of the biggest gambles of his tenure as head of the U.N. nuclear agency.
articles.lead_paragraph: VIENNA — Late in August, Mohamed ElBaradei put the finishing touches on a nuclear accord negotiated in secret with Iran.
articles.byline: By Elaine Sciolino and William J. Broad

articles.headline: Pillow Talk for the Weary
articles.snippet: Yet another wave of bed amenities is here, with lighter, softer sheets that keep you cool, and thicker mattresses that can feel better than the one you have at home.
articles.abstract: Yet another wave of bed amenities is here, with lighter, softer sheets that keep you cool, and thicker mattresses that can feel better than the one you have at home.
articles.lead_paragraph: THE Benjamin, a hotel in Manhattan that caters to the stylish business traveler, has introduced its latest amenity: new clothes for the beds.

articles.headline: New Menus, New Mission for Breakfast
articles.snippet: The hotel industry is creating menus that emphasize health, renewal and, especially, a better grade of coffee.
articles.abstract: The hotel industry is creating menus that emphasize health, renewal and, especially, a better grade of coffee.
articles.lead_paragraph: PITY the executive whose life is filled with crammed planes, missed connections and a workday that begins early and lasts as long as the Internet connection holds up.
